cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi SSE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking generally northwest, expected to enter the southern Gulf Monday, reach the central Gulf Tuesday, and approach the Louisiana-Mississippi coast on Wednesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana–Mississippi coast (near southeast LA / MS Gulf Coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for U.S. coast as of Advisory #5
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for U.S. coast as of Advisory #5
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward across Mississippi and Alabama coastlines
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (≥39 mph) possible by Wednesday with a 36 % cumulative chance; 50-kt winds have an 11 % chance.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Early guidance suggests surge potential of over 3 ft along the MS coast if Zeta strengthens to a hurricane before landfall.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–6 inches of rain possible beginning Wednesday could cause flash-flooding in coastal Mississippi.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Coastal flooding, hazardous seas, and possible port approach channel shoaling due to wave action.
